job_title: Tutor in River Grove, IL
pros: Students are great and it's a pleasure to work with them.
cons: Low pay, absolutely no opportunity for a job change or salary increase. Tutors with master's degrees are paid $18 per hour. You will never get $23. Although the tutoring center has a director and three or four coordinators, it is disorganized. You will be expected to tutor students (even though they have some front desk duties), answer their messages and emails, and schedule sessions for them. There is too much work for too little money! PS Avoid this place if you're an immigrant. There is no way you will receive the same respect as white Americans.

job_title: Special Education Teacher in River Grove, IL
pros: Not many left but coworkers CAN be great. Made many friends here. The students are great because the community is nice.
cons: Triton doesn't value employees in general, which is a shame because they keep losing employees, many of them very good ones. The management makes it horribly toxic to work here. Some have no people skills. Sadder still is that an already underprivileged and impoverished community suffers. In meetings and on their website, Triton preaches equity, but the reality couldn't be further from their mission or their vision statements.

job_title: Associate Director of Facilities in River Grove, IL
pros: It’s a job. It pays…not much
cons: -zero accountability -zero preventative maintenance all reactive maintenance -nothing gets done no one cares -the guy at the top knows nothing about how to run facilities. All mechanical rooms look like a tornado hit them and he could care less

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in River Grove, IL
pros: Flexibility with your schedule if you are in school. If you work hard and are interested in working in enrollment services there can be room for advancement.
cons: Unfortunately, you can advance, but the pay increase is not significant. Also, there is a cap on growth along with appreciation. They are not open to remote work, which has been proven effective. Therefore not interested in creating a work-life balance for employees. Very outdated approach.

job_title: Office Assistant in River Grove, IL
pros: Triton College is extremely unlikely to drop you at the drop of a hat. Even if you're employed as hourly (which I was for many years), barring something heinous you'll still have a job at the end of the day.

job_title: in River Grove, IL
pros:
Pros
The best part about Triton College is its location.
River Grove is a great town with wonderful people, places to eat, and shopping.
Helping students realize their potential is a wonderful role
cons:
Cons
The board president is not educated, resents people who are, and only cares about the 40 million dollar budget. His hires reflect this. 
The most frustrating part of working at the college is being managed by an administration that is clueless about educational pedagogy and principles.
The administrators NEVER visit the classrooms. They have convinced themeselves that they know their students and they have no idea or desire to know what is really going on.
The standards at the school have declined consistently in the past five years, with valued, seasoned teaching staff leaving out of frustration.
There is NO respect for the teachers from the administration, and any attempt to question constantly changing policies can be met with dismissal.
Since the administration has no clue about the students, they can't begin to address their REAL needs.

review_title: Great Opportunity For Students And Staff
job_title: Adjunct Professor in Westchester, IL
pros: Very nice campus with recently renovated buildings and facilities.  Triton is currently undergoing growth in the vocational and technology program areas.  A real sense of community and inclusion is experienced working with fellow staff and administration.  Their clear focus and priority is the student.  Outreach and other on-campus events ensure that their goals and initiatives are reaching as many as possible.
cons: Continued networking and outreach with local businesses to help direct further program growth area(s).

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in River Grove, IL
pros: The faculty and staff are wonderful colleagues, and the atmosphere between full and part-time faculty is very healthy. The students are (largely) eager to learn and responsive to teachers.
cons: Adjunct pay isn't great, even compared to other area community colleges, and the ability to choose one's schedule is limited, which can make it difficult to pick up classes at other schools.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in River Grove, IL
pros: Triton has a good faculty.
cons: The quality of the students is not very good.  Although there are some excellent students, there is a growing number of students who show disrespect towards authority and are more interested in playing with their cell phones than in paying attention in class.

job_title: Audio Visual Equipment Assistant in Schiller Park, IL
pros: Flexible work schedule. My supervisors accommodated my work schedule around my school schedule. Employees receive one free class per semester.
cons: Low pay, at least for my position.
